alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 8:53PM CDT until April 23 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. .The combination of snow melt and rainfall has resulted in moderate flooding for Galesville and minor flooding for Black River Falls. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 47.0 feet, Some rural roads may begin to flood including county Highway VV downstream near the La Crosse County line. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 47.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Saturday was 51.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 38.1 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 47.0 feet on 03/30/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1030 AM CDT.
